intro: Croton antanosiensis, commonly known as the Madagascar croton, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often colorful foliage. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
